title: Bug: When the primary key contains /, an error occurs when updating data
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Steps to reproduce ? When the value of the primary key in my data table contains /, when updating the data, the relevant API will treat the slash as a url route, resulting in the failure of the data to be updated successfully  Desired Behavior I tried escaping the / as %2f when submitting the data update request, and that does the trick  Project Details docker  Attachements ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81417218/209652132-bf8589df-696d-4a58-ad1a-1ef4fa015769.png)

text_for_topic_modeling: NocoDB can't display the values of a cell when it's of type `LinkToAnotherRecord` and has hundreds of connections ## Problem I have a table for email addresses and a table for newsletter subscribers. I added 50.000 subscribers to one newsletter. Therefore, there are 50,000 connections in the "Addresses" field in the newsletter table for the row "Wheelmap". You can see this also in the video. In the newsletter table, we see only ~30 connections. But when we switch to the email address table, we see that also emails like `7444@test.com` have also a connection to the newseltter. https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24459435/171715335-892f9626-52f0-44e0-85a2-571b0d37d80c.mov The response by the REST API shows the same as the client: <details> <summary>Response</summary> title: Bug: Wrong baseId is used in QuickImport, when a secondary database is only active. So the Table is created in the hidden DB.
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Steps to reproduce ? 1. Setup secondary catabase connection ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42977205/218985622-98fc3fc8-d57f-4430-9616-014c59108592.png) 2. Deactivate base connection ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42977205/218985808-fac9c778-64b3-47ca-a109-3953e3989145.png) 3. Import a Table from csv, excel, json with the Drag / Load Dialog ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42977205/218985866-5c945f27-5153-429b-9427-b1d07f5aa7f6.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42977205/218985927-db5dd272-1252-42e1-9367-6f86e087ed8d.png)  Desired Behavior The Table will be created in the enabled Database not the hidden once.  Project Details  Docker used: false NocoDB Version: develop NC_DB: NC_DB="mysql2://<ip>:3306?u=<user>&p=<password>&d=nocodb"   Attachments Possible Fix: 1. File: https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/blob/develop/packages/nc-gui/composables/useProject.ts Change: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42977205/218988734-771d6b74-4533-4373-a52a-bef198e259fe.png) 2. File: https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/blob/develop/packages/nc-gui/pages/[projectType]/[projectId]/index/index/index.vue Change: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42977205/218989535-22ddda09-38c7-4975-b941-53af8f4e9cb6.png) > :info: **Hurray!**: For me it will fix also this issue (that was still an issue): https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/4633

title: Bug: Use of lengthy text in form input label & help text
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Steps to reproduce ? Use of lengthy text in - Form input label - text gets truncated - Form help text - overflows  Desired Behavior text should wrap around & gets displayed in multiple lines  Project Details Node: **v16.14.0** Arch: **arm64** Platform: **darwin** Docker: **false** RootDB: **sqlite3** PackageVersion: **0.106.0-beta.1**  Attachments ![Screenshot 2023-04-10 at 7 54 02 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86527202/230813167-a3283243-111c-49be-b3bb-68611ea66212.png)

title: Commenter / Viewer see controls they cannot use
description: Both in preview mode and in a normal user session CRUD controls (and not only the view-only/commenting ones) are shown to the user. Then an error is shown but it would be more intuitive to hide such controls. This happens in multiple places: - "My Projects" page - "Table" view toolbar (Add new row, Save, Delete table) - "Table" view (contextual controls, like add a file to be uploaded etc) - Edit row modal box (Toggle comments, Save Row) I'm not able to suggest an elegant and practical solution as I'm no familiar with the codebase. Normally there is some centralized component that exposes the permission system to the UI. BTW: Very cool project!

title: Bug: When searching for a non-existant entry it is fine on page 1 of tables but shows"internal error" when doing the same in any other page number.
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Steps to reproduce ? Bug: When searching for a non-existant entry it is fine on page 1 but shows"internal error" when doing the same in any other page number. 1. Create 30 entries. 2. Got to page 2 which now shows 5 entries. 3. Search for non-existant entry. 4. See internal error happen.  Desired Behavior It should just show no result or the result as applicable like it does on page 1  Project Details Nocodb latest with docker. postgres.  Attachments ![image](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/assets/43231640/90d09b5e-e34f-4f43-acc7-ac7d53a2ce4a) Nothing in the logs about the problem.

title: Bug: Accessing the page through the sharing link of Base, there exists the create view button under the table of the left-sidebar, but creating a new view through the create view button will get an error message: Request failed with status code 403
description: Please confirm that the bug report does not already exist - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this bug.  Steps to reproduce 1. Click the share button in the upper right corner 2. Open sharing link of the Base 3. Accessing the sharing link 4. Expand the table under the shared Base and you will find the create view button 5. Creating a new view through the create view button, then you will get an error message: Request failed with status code 403  Desired Behavior 1. I want to know if it was specifically designed this way or if this is a bug 2. if this is a bug, I think the create view button should be hidden  Project Details Node: **v20.12.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.250.2**  Attachments _No response_

title: No Decimal Place on Some Formula Outputs where Needed
description: **Please enter the following details** Please provide the following details : NocoDB used as docker : false NocoDB version : Database used in NC_DB URL : sqlite3 Project was created by clicking : New Project Database on which spreadsheet is created : sqlite3 OS on which NocoDB is running : heroku? Node.js version if running as node : Database version : No idea **Steps To Reproduce** 1. 1 click deploy via heroku, add a new table (not sure if my background stats are correct for my environment but as of today, 9/14/2021, I hit one click deploy of onto heroku and tested out the default setup) 2. Add two integer columns with integer types to the new table 3. Enter 1 in the first column and 4 in the second column 3. Add an formula column as a third column, make it the average of the prior two integer columns 4. See the following "error" - the output is 2 and there is no way to change the view to display a decimal, presumably because the formula column has inherited the integer type from the two columns it depends on. **Expected behavior** While from some developer's perspective, displaying the average of 1 and 4 as the integer 2 might be the "expected behavior" in the sense that they would know that the formula column is coded to inherit the types of the columns it depends on. From a no-code user's perspective like me - I expect to see 2.5 or if I see 2, I expect to be able to change the view or some other property of the formula column to display the correct average of the two columns: 2.5 Join our discord : https://discord.gg/5RgZmkW for realtime help.
patched_file_types: source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file

title: Select v2: configuring default value for multi select
description: Node: **v16.14.0** Arch: **arm64** Platform: **darwin** Docker: **false** Database: **sqlite3** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **sqlite3** PackageVersion: **0.92.4** - consider for options configured as a, b, c, d - doesn't work: set default value as `a,b` [options separated by comma without any additional space after comma]  GET /api/v1/db/data/noco/x/md_0uwut02cayvoey/views/vw_8jr05u93l8su7e/count 200 11 - 10.596 ms     EXCEPTION OCCURED!! in SqliteClient @ tableUpdate   - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   MESSAGE:   ALTER TABLE `nc_c12h__Sheet2` ADD `title7` text DEFAULT a,b - SQLITE_ERROR: near ",": syntax error     - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   CODE:   SQLITE_ERROR     - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   STACK:   Error: ALTER TABLE `nc_c12h__Sheet2` ADD `title7` text DEFAULT a,b - SQLITE_ERROR: near ",": syntax error     - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -       [Error: ALTER TABLE `nc_c12h__Sheet2` ADD `title7` text DEFAULT a,b - SQLITE_ERROR: near ",": syntax error] { errno: 1, code: 'SQLITE_ERROR' } columnAdd :: [Error: ALTER TABLE `nc_c12h__Sheet2` ADD `title7` text DEFAULT a,b - SQLITE_ERROR: near ",": syntax error] { errno: 1, code: 'SQLITE_ERROR' }  - works: set default value as `[a,b]` [options separated by comma & bounded by square braces] - doesn't work: set default value as `[a, b]` [same as above, with space induced after comma]. No error, but default value is displayed as only `a`  Expected - what ever option we intend to support, has to be set in the example. - would prefer selecting options using drop down like we do it in the cell - if it has to be via text input, I would prefer it as comma separated values without explicit square brace bound

description: please provide the following details : NocoDB used as docker : false NocoDB version : 0.81.1 Database used in NC_DB URL : sqlite3 Project was created by clicking : New Project Database on which spreadsheet is created : sqlite3 OS on which NocoDB is running : macos 12.0.1 Node.js version if running as node : v14.17.1 Database version : NA **Steps To Reproduce** 1. `cd` to folder with spaces in the path (ie: `/Users/flavien/Developer/My Repositories`) 2. Run `npx create-nocodb-app` 3. Answer questions (sqlite3, as Node.js Project) And here it is:  Now, executing command : cd /Users/flavien/Developer/My Repositories/impressed_ferret /bin/sh: line 0: cd: /Users/flavien/Developer/My: No such file or directory Error running command internally "cd /Users/flavien/Developer/My Repositories/impressed_ferret" Exiting  **Expected behavior** Take spaces in path into account, and don't throw error. **Screenshots** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46444098/140413033-a1720e15-ab88-400f-83dd-14d1e013ecf7.png) Join our discord : https://discord.gg/5RgZmkW for realtime help. title: Facing issue while using Monaco editor present in Nocodb
description: Hi, I have been trying to use MonacoTsEditor present in Nocodb as code editor instead of normal textarea. Facing below issue while using it ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86340924/124745086-0da75000-df3d-11eb-9633-8c27a3502541.png) I have used it as below: - import the editor ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86340924/124745210-32032c80-df3d-11eb-980c-e9dc3f971768.png) - include in component ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86340924/124745299-49dab080-df3d-11eb-9ca6-409d5a90e69f.png) - use it ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86340924/124745346-5959f980-df3d-11eb-91f0-b44f51186bf4.png) I tried debugging and found may be web workers are not loading correctly. Currently temporary workaround I am using it is to comment the model initialization. But then code color doesn't come and few features are removed. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86340924/124746646-befab580-df3e-11eb-845d-b102a023a6fb.png) Overall I am trying to add abstract type code editor where I can store code snippets There is also warning comes when activating few other monaco editor like sql ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86340924/124747260-5fe97080-df3f-11eb-82f7-3bfc3107e77c.png) It doesn't cause issue in execution but too many cause lag in ui Steps to produce(both for ts and sql editor): - Implement it - Error comes in console when it is activated Node: **v14.15.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **win32** Docker: **false** Database: **sqlite3** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **sqlite3** PackageVersion: **0.9.41**

title: Error: Cannot find module 'jsonfile'
description: When running pnpm. title: Feature: Add a settings per projects and/or per tables for the pagination and number of rows shown
description: Please confirm if feature request does NOT exist already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Describe the usecase for the feature Currently, the only way to change the number of rows displayed, is to change the environment variable (see https://docs.nocodb.com/getting-started/self-hosted/environment-variables/) `DB_QUERY_LIMIT_DEFAULT`.  Suggested Solution It would be great to be able to change that number per projects, and even per tables (since you can have a case where you want your users to be able to sift through huge number of rows for simple tables, but want to prevent overloading your server with more complex tables).  Additional Context Ideally, this feature would allow the user to change the default 25 rows limit without having to change the env variable. This feature could play well with the [infinite scroll feature request](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/issues/3568) as well.

title: Email address used for authentication should be case-insensitive
description: The email address field used for sign up / sign in / reset password is not marked at type="email". Since it's not marked as an email field browsers will sometimes automatically capitalize the first letter when typed (as opposed to auto-fill). The email address used in sign up / sign in is treated as case sensitive. These two things combined create friction for new users and less technical users. My ideal is that both these fields would be marked as type="email" and emails would be treated as case insensitive. If just one of the two are implemented it would improve user experience. According to RFC 1035 the bit before the @ sign may be case sensitive and the part after the @ sign is not case sensitive. In practice, email addresses are considered case insensitive. For example, Gmail (one of the largest email providers) treats email addresses as case insensitive. please provide the following details : (details not provided are unknown, I don't see the option to copy project info as shown in the YouTube video) NocoDB version : 0.11.39 Database used in NC_DB URL : pg **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Using Safari on MacOS open a private window (browsers learn what fields are email addresses, opening a private window creates a window in which it has not yet learned that the field is an email address and will therefore capitalize the first letter) 2. navigate to sign in, sign up, or forgot password 3. start typing an email address with a period in it such as first.last@gmail.com 4. Safari will capitalize the first letter once the period is typed. **Expected behavior** Email addresses should not be automatically capitalized.

title: Bug: Formula doesn't update and deletes data in other fields if ENTER isn't pressed in other fields
description: Please confirm that the bug report does not already exist - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this bug.  Steps to reproduce 1. Create a Currency field called "Unit Cost": ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5fbeec59-e6fe-4e9d-94ee-73e14ff3a1b8) 2. Create a Number field called "Quantity": ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/963b39eb-5520-4422-a1b1-5d9649a3e181) 3. Create a Formula field that calculates the multiplies the fields: `({Unit Cost} * {Quantity})`: ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/addb60eb-b60e-4943-b618-4ced4187bc97) 4. Create a sum at the bottom of the Formula field: ![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6d40fce1-da0e-419e-a043-8b1e5c9bb36a) 5. Enter numbers in the records. The formulas aren't automatically updated, and the data in other fields may get deleted: ![](https://i.imgur.com/YUnZZrv.gif) https://i.imgur.com/YUnZZrv.mp4 The data only gets saved and updated if you hit ENTER The sum only gets updated if you re-select it  Desired Behavior The formula field should update automatically, and not delete the data in other fields. It should get saved and updated whether you hit ENTER or click away from the cell  Project Details Hosted app.nocodb.com  Attachments _No response_

The formulas aren't automatically updated, and the data in other fields may get deleted: ![](https://i.imgur.com/YUnZZrv.gif) https://i.imgur.com/YUnZZrv.mp4 The data only gets saved and updated if you hit ENTER The sum only gets updated if you re-select it  Desired Behavior The formula field should update automatically, and not delete the data in other fields. It should get saved and updated whether you hit ENTER or click away from the cell  Project Details Hosted app.nocodb.com  Attachments _No response_ source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file

title: Issue: Align data to top in grid view
description: Hi, When too much data is present in one cell, it causes other cell data to be aligned in middle. This makes reading the other cell data difficult. In case data could be aligned at top it will be readable quicker. Steps to reproduce: 1- Put too much data in longtext cell 2- Put data in cell with single line 3- Select grid view ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86340924/125628773-dc2773d7-5f68-4cd3-ae08-336ed527d8e9.png)

text_for_topic_modeling: Issue: Align data to top in grid view Hi, When too much data is present in one cell, it causes other cell data to be aligned in middle. This makes reading the other cell data difficult. In case data could be aligned at top it will be readable quicker. Steps to reproduce: 1- Put too much data in longtext cell 2- Put data in cell with single line 3- Select grid view title: Docker Volume for App
description: What is the volume for persistence? I referred to the `docker-compose.yml` on the codebase, but it does not have a volume for persistence on the nocodb app. I find that each time I recreate the container, I have to see the welcome splash and setup my users again. Metadata also have to be reset each time. Someone on discord mentioned `/usr/src/app`, but I tried this and it didn't work, nor could I find this anywhere else. Any official documentation? :)

title: No Access to any project using API Key
description: **Please enter the following details** Node: **v12.22.6** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.84.12** please provide the following details : **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create Project 2. Create API Key 3. Go To Swagger, Authenticate (works using API Key) 4. (optional) change user password etc., all from "Authenticate" works fine 5. Get List in Project, does not work using API key. `ERROR: Forbidden - perhaps check your credentials? Access Denied : Please Login or Signup for a new account`. It works using "Copy Auth Token" though. **Extra steps undertaken (suspected header auth issue) 1. Using nginx reverse proxy, forwarded xc-header. No change in behavior. 2. deployed exposing the port directly, no change in behaviour 3. added the URL and backend URL, no change in behaviour **Expected behavior** Works normally without error I mean, it should be possible using the API key, right? Or am I SUPPOSED to use the refresh token from the login?

title: Lookup columns used in filters and formulas cause errors
description: Lookup columns referencing parent's field return errors if used in filters or formulas. Issue is not related to data type (tested with strings and numbers). Lookups from parent entry work as expected. Error message from example below complains on missing '__nc0.nc_0ysj__types_id' and named alike columns. <details> <summary>.gif example</summary> ![Peek 2022-04-21 15-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61871501/165140280-18c1e1f6-13d9-4b0a-a6d0-1a3ff584cccc.gif) </details> Known since v0.90.5.

title: Changing single select fields results in webhooks getting called twice
description: Node: **v12.22.6** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.84.12** **Steps To Reproduce** I've set up an ON UPDATE + condition webhook (URL). (when a field is set to true execute POST call) But for some reason, it always executes twice. i.e. I get 2 calls executed for a single update. Only 1 webhook is being used throughout the whole organization (there were more previously which I've removed). Not sure what it does but clicked on "reload" as well. **Expected behavior** Webhook is only executed once for a single row update **Screenshots** https://i.imgur.com/4rGpHg6.png

title: LinktoAnotherRecord shows a time stamp instead of the selected entry
description: Project info: Node: **v12.22.6** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **mysql2** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.83.5** mysql version: :5.7 usage of the provided docker-compose file in /mysql without modifications. Project was created by clicking : New Project se Database on which spreadsheet is created : mysql **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create two tables 2. Create a new column in table 1. Select LnktoAnotherRecord point to table2 3. Select an entry for the first row in table 1. Selection seems valid 4. Select an entry for the second row in table 1. Selection window is valid, but the entry shows a timestamp 5. Select another table or refresh the browser page. The time entry row is gone. **Expected behavior** 1. Starting from row 2, one expect the see the same possible selections as it works for row 1. **Screenshots** ![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2484912/143931645-8ad61e3a-462e-4f8a-9c3c-5913cb775193.png) Join our discord : https://discord.gg/5RgZmkW for realtime help. title: Bug: inactive trigger doesn't change to active.
description: Please confirm that the bug report does not already exist - [x] I confirm there is no existing issue for this bug.  Steps to reproduce 1. Create a trigger on any other type of webhook but manual 2. Change to inactive 3. Edit the type to manual trigger I get that the toggle must be disabled, but keeping it inactive doesn't show on the list that can be choose in the button field in the "Run webhook" mode  Desired Behavior The most simple solution should be that the webhook should change to active when is updated to manual trigger. If is expected that active status should also filter in the button list, then the active toggle should also be able to change for manual trigger, otherwise if shouldn't be a filter, the list shouldn't filter if the webhook was marked as unactive.  Project Details Node: **v22.14.0** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.262.5**  Attachments _No response_

title: Add _version or _health route
description: I'd like to include a health check into the docker file. E.g. HEALTHCHECK --interval=5s --timeout=3s \ CMD curl --fail http://localhost:$PORT/_health || exit 1 So it would be nice to have a `/_health` route or something similar. The controller function should check if the connection to the mysql database is still alive. Or maybe a `_version` route, where `xmysql` responses with the connected `mysql` version. This can also be used for a health check. What do you think?

title: DATEADD formula issues
description: Using DATEADD formula (`IF(NOW() < DATEADD(test_date_time,10,'day'), "true", "false")` like in [docs](https://docs.nocodb.com/setup-and-usages/formulas#date-functions)) results in empty table. There is error console with code 400 in response to GET database entries request. Response body has message noting that there is no $1 operator: `timestamp with time zone < text`. To test, I've tried basic image ( `docker run -d --name nocodb -p 8080:8080 nocodb/nocodb:latest`) and there DATEADD works, though date subtraction fails, as it planned in #1415 . Providing negative number in formula results in 400 error with msg "Cannot read property 'argument' of undefined". Node: **v12.22.10** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.84.16**
text_for_topic_modeling: DATEADD formula issues Using DATEADD formula (`IF(NOW() < DATEADD(test_date_time,10,'day'), "true", "false")` like in [docs](https://docs.nocodb.com/setup-and-usages/formulas#date-functions)) results in empty table. There is error console with code 400 in response to GET database entries request. Response body has message noting that there is no $1 operator: `timestamp with time zone < text`. To test, I've tried basic image ( `docker run -d --name nocodb -p 8080:8080 nocodb/nocodb:latest`) and there DATEADD works, though date subtraction fails, as it planned in #1415 . Providing negative number in formula results in 400 error with msg "Cannot read property 'argument' of undefined". Node: **v12.22.10** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.84.16** source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file

title: Feature: Use AWS instance/container IAM profiles for S3 access
description: Please confirm if feature request does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Describe the usecase for the feature Today, it is [required to explicitly define](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/blob/804edeeacf253e09ba58d9bfc0ac757f0e0163d7/packages/nocodb/src/helpers/NcPluginMgrv2.ts#L113-L118) `NC_S3_ACCESS_SECRET` and `NC_S3_ACCESS_KEY`, which implies the necessity to create persistent access keys. However, this should not be required when running NocoDB in an AWS service with builtin IAM roles, such as ECS task containers or EC2 instances, which can supply their own IAM roles through the environment. SDKs can access the builtin IAM roles without the need to configure static credentials. The lack of this feature means that users must forego best practices of using builtin service-based roles and places an additional burden of provisioning, monitoring, and rotating standard access keys.  Suggested Solution NocoDB should only necessarily require `NC_S3_BUCKET_NAME` to configure use of object storage when running in AWS ECS or EC2 (or similar). For example, when running in ECS, the [ECS task role](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/task-iam-roles.html) can be used for accessing S3. The AWS SDK uses this as part of its standardized credential providers. When running AWS SDKs in AWS services, providing explicit access keys is not necessary and it will detect container task credentials automatically. Typically, this means just simply omitting the access key ID and secret key parameters altogether and relying on the normal [precedence of settings](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sdkref/latest/guide/settings-reference.html#precedenceOfSettings) to automatically configure credentials.  Additional Context _No response_

title: Migration from 0084002 to 0090000 failed
description:
NocoDB used as docker : false NocoDB version : 0.91.0 Database used in NC_DB URL : mysql2 Database on which spreadsheet is created : mysql2 OS on which NocoDB is running : Windows Node.js version if running as node : v16.14.0  **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Have an existing setup to be updated to newer version of nocodb. 2. Execute command `npm uninstall nocodb` 3. Execute command `npm install --save nocodb` 4. Complete installation without issue 5. Execute command `npm start` 6. Get error: sh This error originated either by throwing inside of an async function without a catch block, or by rejecting a promise which was not handled with .catch(). title: Bug: Webhook call sending Parameters doesn't work
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this Steps to reproduce ? Hey there, since the last update the sending Parameters via web hook fails. 1. Create Webhook 2. Create parameters 3. Test webhook 4. Newly created parameters (after the update) are not attached to the web hook 5. Parameters created before the update are attached to the web hook Desired Behavior attach all Parameters. I think the issue is, that in the current version the check boxes are missing for the parameters. When you go on the headers tab, then the check boxes are still there. title: Upload CSV Import Error
description: NocoDB used as docker : false NocoDB version : 0.83.8 Database used in NC_DB URL : sqlite3 Project was created by clicking : New Project Database on which spreadsheet is created : sqlite3 OS on which NocoDB is running : Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS Node.js version if running as node : v14.13.0 Database version : 3.33.0 **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Go to New/Existing Project -> Tables -> New/Existing table 2. Click on Action -> Upload CSV -> Select any csv file having all the required columns (id, title) -> Import 3. See error: POST /nc/xyz_op0t/api/v1/xyz/bulk 400 40 - 7.051 ms .returning() is not supported by sqlite3 and will not have any effect. **Expected behavior** The selected CSV file is supposed to be imported and shown as table. **Screenshots** ![Screenshot from 2021-12-18 23-31-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36279345/146651266-7e51be31-3aa1-4a6b-9177-5e23ea214762.png) ![Screenshot from 2021-12-18 23-32-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36279345/146651350-7953badf-56a1-44f2-b56d-2f9b30bd2a7c.png) ![Screenshot from 2021-12-18 23-32-26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36279345/146651360-ee56d427-3ec1-4829-829b-8ca782485111.png) ![Screenshot from 2021-12-18 23-32-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36279345/146651370-77eb6eeb-b2ee-408b-bded-764eb4a50dee.png) ![Screenshot from 2021-12-18 23-32-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36279345/146651378-4c2081b4-1ac8-4776-87c2-e75c4b263f4e.png) ![Screenshot from 2021-12-18 23-33-14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36279345/146651386-34f51369-98ae-48b0-974b-69b3e305fd77.png)

title: Bug: Unable to add new record to linked table by "add new link"
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exist already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Steps to reproduce ? - I'm using app.nocodb.com, haven't validated in a self-hosted installation - Create two new tables within a single base - Add a new field with - Type: "link" - Relation: either "many to many" or "has many" - Child table: whichever table not currently using - On record, select open "linked records" - Select "link records" - select "new record" - Attempt typing into any fields on the new record, **text appears in the previous "link records" window's search barnot in the "new record" fields.** - I'm able to get data to populate there by right clicking to paste. Typing directly or using keyboard shortcuts is not working for me.  Desired Behavior Able to type directly into a new linked record's fields without a workaround.  Project Details NocoDB used in the app.nocodb.com site, not self-installed Bases created within app.nocodb.com, not connected to an external data source  Attachments https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/assets/66445285/a6dcccf9-af4f-47ea-b062-0cf9d153895d

title: Column with checkbox type may not be updated for consecutive clicks
description: **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create a project 2. Create a table 3. Create a column with checkbox type 4. Input multiple records, says 10 records 5. Tick all the record one by one as fast as you could 6. The UI is updated but some may be not ticked after clicking review Basically it's fine only If I click it, wait for the message box popping out, then click the next one. If I click them quickly, some may be not updated. **Expected behavior** The checkbox values can be updated even I click them fast. Node: v12.22.6 Arch: x64 Platform: linux Docker: false Database: pg ProjectOnRootDB: false RootDB: pg PackageVersion: 0.81.1
patched_file_types: other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | source-file

title: NC_PUBLIC_URL not honored in invite email
description: **Please enter the following details** Node: **v12.22.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.11.2** **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Configure the env variable `NC_PUBLIC_URL`. Example : "https://my-site.com/database" 2. Invite someone by email 3. Configured URL is not honored. Link is something like "https://my-site.com/dashboard" instead of "https://my-site.com/database/dashboard" **Expected behavior** The invite URL should use the `NC_PUBLIC_URL`.

title: Bug: Unable to drop column of a composite primary key in Postgres
description: Version: 0.9.24 Environment: Docker (x86) When attempting to drop a column of a composite primary key in Postgres, it appears that it's not properly terminating separate SQL statements. To replicate via the UI: 1. Create an empty table with the default columns 2. Add an additional primary key column (e.g. `iduuid` type `uuid`) 3. Try to delete the original `id` column In this error (below) - you can see that there is no semicolon separating the initial column drop and the second constraint drop. In addition, the constraint should be dropped prior to the column being dropped. The error generated is:      EXCEPTION OCCURED!! in PGClient @ tableUpdate   - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   MESSAGE:   ALTER TABLE "xa3__test" DROP COLUMN "id"alter TABLE "xa3__test" drop constraint xa3__test_pkey;alter TABLE "xa3__test" add constraint xa3__test_pkey PRIMARY KEY(tmpid); - syntax error at or near "alter"     - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   CODE:   42601     - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   STACK:   error: ALTER TABLE "xa3__test" DROP COLUMN "id"alter TABLE "xa3__test" drop constraint xa3__test_pkey;alter TABLE "xa3__test" add constraint xa3__test_pkey PRIMARY KEY(tmpid); - syntax error at or near "alter"   at Parser.parseErrorMessage (/usr/src/app/node_modules/pg-protocol/dist/parser.js:287:98)   at Parser.handlePacket (/usr/src/app/node_modules/pg-protocol/dist/parser.js:126:29)   at Parser.parse (/usr/src/app/node_modules/pg-protocol/dist/parser.js:39:38)   at Socket.<anonymous> (/usr/src/app/node_modules/pg-protocol/dist/index.js:11:42)   at Socket.emit (events.js:314:20)   at Socket.EventEmitter.emit (domain.js:483:12)   at addChunk (_stream_readable.js:297:12)   at readableAddChunk (_stream_readable.js:272:9)   at Socket.Readable.push (_stream_readable.js:213:10)   at TCP.onStreamRead (internal/stream_base_commons.js:188:23)     - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

title: Error when editing a SingleSelect column

NocoDB used as docker : true NocoDB version : v0.84.15 Database used in NC_DB URL : mysql Project was created by clicking : New Project Database on which spreadsheet is created : mysql OS on which NocoDB is running : ubuntu Node.js version if running as node : Database version : 10.7.3 **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Go to Table with a SingleSelect column type 2. Click on Edit and add an option. 3. Displays an error. **Expected behavior** An error should not happen. **Log**  Error: ALTER TABLE `nc_ve0y__players` CHANGE COLUMN `Buy or Sell` `Buy or Sell` enum('Sell','Buy','Maybe Buy','Maybe Sell') NULL DEFAULT "NULL"; - Invalid default value for 'Buy or Sell' at Packet.asError (/usr/src/app/node_modules/mysql2/lib/packets/packet.js:728:17) at Query.execute (/usr/src/app/node_modules/mysql2/lib/commands/command.js:29:26) at Connection.handlePacket (/usr/src/app/node_modules/mysql2/lib/connection.js:456:32) at PacketParser.onPacket (/usr/src/app/node_modules/mysql2/lib/connection.js:85:12) at PacketParser.executeStart (/usr/src/app/node_modules/mysql2/lib/packet_parser.js:75:16) at Socket.<anonymous> (/usr/src/app/node_modules/mysql2/lib/connection.js:92:25) at Socket.emit (events.js:314:20) at Socket.EventEmitter.emit (domain.js:483:12) at addChunk (_stream_readable.js:297:12) at readableAddChunk (_stream_readable.js:272:9) { code: 'ER_INVALID_DEFAULT', errno: 1067, sqlState: '42000', sqlMessage: "Invalid default value for 'Buy or Sell'", sql: 'ALTER TABLE `nc_ve0y__players`

title: Connect to MySQL with require_secure_transport = ON
description: Node: **v15.12.0** Arch: **x64** Platform: **darwin** Docker: **false** Database: **mysql2** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.11.8** **Expected behavior** Currently using MaraDB in docker. Image ID: fd17f5776802. We would like to use SSL to connect to the DB without acertificate verification. Currently there is no way to do this using the NC_DB variable. Technically, you should be able to add NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED = "0" to the environment, and ssl would work. But this throws: TypeError: SSL profile must be an object, instead it's a boolean. This is a bug in the MySQL Driver. What is needed, is to create this object and pass it to KNEX config: const knex = require('knex')({ client: 'mysql2', connection: { user: 'root', password: 'pass', host: 'localhost', database: 'db', ssl: {rejectUnauthorized: false} } }); The end result is being able to connect to mysql with require_secure_transport = ON. [my.cnf.zip](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/files/6930528/my.cnf.zip)
text_for_topic_modeling: Connect to MySQL with require_secure_transport = ON Node: **v15.12.0** Arch: **x64** Platform: **darwin** Docker: **false** Database: **mysql2** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.11.8** **Expected behavior** Currently using MaraDB in docker. Image ID: fd17f5776802. We would like to use SSL to connect to the DB without acertificate verification. Currently there is no way to do this using the NC_DB variable. Technically, you should be able to add NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED = "0" to the environment, and ssl would work. But this throws: TypeError: SSL profile must be an object, instead it's a boolean. This is a bug in the MySQL Driver. What is needed, is to create this object and pass it to KNEX config: const knex = require('knex')({ client: 'mysql2', connection: { user: 'root', password: 'pass', host: 'localhost', database: 'db', ssl: {rejectUnauthorized: false} } }); The end result is being able to connect to mysql with require_secure_transport = ON. [my.cnf.zip](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/files/6930528/my.cnf.zip) test-file source-file test-file source-file

title: User invite email issues
description: **Please enter the following details** Node: **v12.22.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.9.32** **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Invite new user with Viewer role 2. Email is sent to new user 3. Email text says `I invited you to be an Admin of the NocoDB project ". Click the button below to to accept my invitation.` **Expected behavior** - The email refers to the invited user as Admin regardless of the role they are given. So an invited user with just the Viewer role is still referred to as an Admin in the email. - Second, the name of the project is missing from the email and instead just has a double quotation mark. - Third, the salutation says `Thanks regards Super admin@example.com` which is strange wording, I'm not sure what "Super" refers to. **Screenshots**

title: Filter doesn't return correct results on linked record
description: please provide the following details : NocoDB used as docker : true NocoDB version : 0.90.3 Database used in NC_DB URL : sqlite3 Project was created by clicking : New Project Database on which spreadsheet is created : sqlite3 **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create two new tables, populate with entries. Case 1: 2. In second table, create a "has many" linked record linked to the first table. 3. Populate the linked record with entries from the first table. 4. Go to the first table, filter by the one-many linked record column. 5. Filter returns every entry if any entry matches the condition, returns no entries if no entry matches the condition (i.e., if the linked records in all of the rows are "A", "B", and "C", filtering for "A" will return all entries, including those linked to "B" and "C", and filtering for "D" will not return anything) Case 2: 6. Now, create a "has many" linked record in the first table which also links to the first table. Populate this with records. 7. Filter by this column. 8. Filter returns the opposite of what is expected -- ie if you filter for "is like" "A", it will return everything that is not like "A", if you filter for "is not like" "A", it will return everything that is like "A". **Expected behavior** In Case 1, the filter should return only the matching entries, not every entry. In Case 2, the filter should return the opposite of what it currently returns.

title: Enhancement: missing cursor when editing for Editors
description: **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create a table and add data using Owner role 2. Try edit data 3. There is no cursor for editors (See screenshot 1 below) while there is for owners (See screenshot 2 below). P.S. editors can edit data though. **Expected behavior** A cursor should be placed for better UX. title: Bug: Unexpected character "}" in M2M relation
description: Unexpected character "}" in M2M relation **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Go to Project Metadata 2. Click DB Metadata 3. Click Relations 4. if you have m2m relationship, you should see something like  # | Table Name (xx/xx) | Relation | Parent | Child | 1 | Table_A | HasMany | Table_A | _nc_m2m_Table_B_Table_A} 2 | _nc_m2m_Table_B_Table_A} | BelongsTo | Table B | _nc_m2m_Table_B_Table_A}  5. Notice that for all ``relation.tn``, there is an unexpected characher ``}`` at the end. **Expected behavior** it should be ``_nc_m2m_Table_B_Table_A`` instead of ``_nc_m2m_Table_B_Table_A}`` Node: **v12.22.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.10.3**

title: Feature request: Json editor in fullscreen
description: Hey, I was checking this awesome app in my docker environment, and it's just impressive :relaxed: I'm not sure if there is already some feature like this: I would like to edit long text and JSON text in full screen or some pop-up. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29312172/134696184-e714f8ac-1e2c-47dd-bc66-567fc8a42d1a.png) Right now the `monaco` editing experience is somehow ruined by the cringing editor dimensions :flushed: I suggest to add the expand icon somewhere near to these fields: In the table view: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29312172/134697367-9dfce9dc-4fda-4f31-915c-75da7626e0c4.png) and in the detail view as well: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29312172/134697500-4fa3d4a5-23a4-4fe8-8a89-84ae24f030e6.png) Thanks upfront
patched_file_types: other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file

title: link to record using pop up "add row" modal - does not work
description: Node: **v14.18.0** Arch: **arm64** Platform: **darwin** Docker: **false** Database: **sqlite3** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **sqlite3** PackageVersion: **0.84.16** - create country hm city relation - add new city in city table (Karachi). don't link to country yet ![Screenshot 2022-04-16 at 2 47 48 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86527202/163669560-0d8c4752-2a6f-4ff3-80ab-2d92f0f90a02.png) - from country table, open add-row pop up modal - enter country name & link to new city added (Karachi) ![Screenshot 2022-04-16 at 2 47 25 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86527202/163669565-2607bfa6-1800-4655-ab38-c9881d4f419d.png) - save record. says successful, but in the table - record is not reflected ![Screenshot 2022-04-16 at 2 47 33 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86527202/163669573-957f1961-20bd-49b0-a305-9c084d0e2bf2.png)

title: Automations "Send Email" doesn't retain input fields
description: NocoDB used as docker : false (heroku) NocoDB version : 0.83.6 Database used in NC_DB URL pg Project was created by clicking : New Project by connecting to external database Database on which spreadsheet is created : pg OS on which NocoDB is running : heroku hobby dynamo Node.js version if running as node : v12.22.6 Database version : * NoCoDB: PostgreSQL 13.5 (Ubuntu 13.5-2.pgdg20.04+1) on x86_64-pc-linux-gnu, compiled by gcc (Ubuntu 9.3.0-17ubuntu1~20.04) 9.3.0, 64-bit * Project DB: PostgreSQL 14.1 on aarch64-unknown-linux-gnu, compiled by gcc (Ubuntu 10.3.0-1ubuntu1~20.04) 10.3.0, 64-bit **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Go to any table 2. Open `Automations` 3. Create new `Automation` and set `Notification` to `Email` 4. Close `Automations` modal window 5. Re-open `Automations` modal window **Expected behavior** Modal should show all the fields that have been set ** Actual Behaviour** Automation fields have been reset Node: **v12.22.6** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **false** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.83.6**

title: Bug: nocodb still allows open invitation if google app ID is set
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Steps to reproduce ? hello! i'm trying to have google auth to an internal nocodb, and i want to prevent anonymous users from signing in. We use google so i set up google integration: * i did configure nocodb with NC_GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET and NC_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID. Also set NC_INVITE_ONLY_SIGNUP * try to signup using an email address (won't work) * try to signup using google (still works)  Desired Behavior i think signing up using google should only work if there is an invite for that google email address outstanding.  Project Details we deployed nocodb:latest in docker using postgres  Attachements _No response_

title: "Editor" role not allowed to upload files
description: Node: **v12.22.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.11.29** **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Log in as a user with "editor" role 2. In an "Attachment" field, try to upload or remove a file **Expected behavior** Editors should be able to manage attachments. Currently, one needs to be "creator" to do this. However, that role also allows users to change the table structure! This is surprising as "editor" is documented as "Can edit records but cannot change structure of database/fields". Being a programmer, I know that attachments are stored separately and only referenced by the record. But I still consider them to be _values_, not part of the _table/database structure_.

Log in as a user with "editor" role 2. In an "Attachment" field, try to upload or remove a file **Expected behavior** Editors should be able to manage attachments. Currently, one needs to be "creator" to do this. However, that role also allows users to change the table structure! This is surprising as "editor" is documented as "Can edit records but cannot change structure of database/fields". Being a programmer, I know that attachments are stored separately and only referenced by the record. But I still consider them to be _values_, not part of the _table/database structure_. other-file source-file other-file source-file

title: Getting xmysql to work on AWS lambda
description: I was able to get xmysql to work on AWS lambda. This is just some docs on the process to help others. Typescript code for index.ts: typescript import * as bodyParser from 'body-parser'; import * as express from 'express'; const serverless = require('serverless-http'); import * as cors from 'cors'; import { APIGatewayEvent, Context } from 'aws-lambda'; import * as config from './util/env-config'; import { NextFunction, Request, Response } from 'express'; import { AutoBeheerderError } from './util/autobeheerder-error'; const mysql = require('mysql'); const Xapi = require('./node_modules/xmysql/lib/xapi.js'); const morgan = require('morgan'); const app = express(); let onXapiInitialized = new Promise<void>((resolve, reject) => { try { // / START : setup express / app.use(morgan('tiny')); app.use(cors()); app.use(bodyParser.json()); app.use(bodyParser.urlencoded({ extended: true })); // / END : setup express / app.use((req: Request, res: Response, next: NextFunction) => { // You can add authentication here console.log('got request for: ' + req.url, req); next(); }); let mysqlConfig = { host: config.envConfig.mysql.host, port: 3306, database: config.envConfig.mysql.database, user: config.envConfig.mysql.user, password: config.envConfig.mysql.password, apiPrefix: '/', ipAddress: 'localhost', portNumber: 3000, ignoreTables: [], storageFolder: __dirname }; let mysqlPool = mysql.createPool(mysqlConfig); let xapi = new Xapi(mysqlConfig, mysqlPool, app); xapi.init(async (err: any, results: any) => { app.listen(3000); resolve(); }); } catch (err) { reject(err); } }); export function handler(event: APIGatewayEvent, context: Context, callback: Function) { onXapiInitialized.then(() => { serverless(app)(event, context, callback); }); }  AWS setup notes: * The deploy uses serverless: https://serverless.com/framework/docs/getting-started/ * The lambda function is accessed through API Gateway and access the RDS (mysql) database ** Make sure you deploy your API Gateway setup otherwise it won't be accessible. * The security setup: ** You need to put your lambda in a VPC ** The lambda role needs access to the VPC ** The RDS server has to be inside the VPC as well Performance: * Requests to the API Gateway resolve in ~ 90ms
patched_file_types: other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | source-file | other-file | source-file

title: Bug: while primary key values contain "/" symbol, expand the row to get Record not found banner.

description: Could you add an option to display comments only (and not the auto generated _edited_ or _created_ entry) in the comment view of a row? The current mix audit / comments make following a conversation between two peoples difficult if the row receives a lot of update.

In my case Edge. - login as admin. In my case - dgleba@gmail.com - sign out. - try to sign in with incorrect username: a and password: a [or any username and password like that]. - projects are shown. username in top corner is `sign up`. - you can edit data. **Expected behavior** incorrect credentials should not give successful access to data. **Screenshots** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true**

title: Feature: Modify Field after Webhook "After Update"
description: Please confirm if feature request does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Describe the usecase for the feature Currently, when trying to use **After Update** webhooks, it is not possible to limit the execution to **only once**. For example, if I want to send an email via a webhook **only once** if a Single Select field is equal to a specific value, I cannot do so. Every time the respective row is updated the email will be sent again so long as the conditional field stays on that specific value. In Airtable, you can update a field value after an automation / webhook to **record an execution and avoid re-execution**. For example, I can create a checkbox field "Email Sent" and can set it to true after the webhook runs to prevent it from sending the email again and again.  Suggested Solution Similar to Airtable, I would recommend the ability to select fields of the trigger row to be set to a specific value in the webhook settings. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7414843/196564472-005eb531-fd12-4fe4-83b1-12489350b1db.png) You could use a similar UI to "On Condition": Checkbox "After Webhook": Allow the user to select arbitrary field and set them to specific values, similar to how users can choose arbitrary fields to monitor for "On Condition".  Additional Context _No response_
patched_file_types: other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file | other-file

title: schema immediately out of sync on postgres when creating table, columns
description: please provide the following details : NocoDB used as docker : true NocoDB version : 0.90.3 Database used in NC_DB URL : pg Project was created by clicking : New Project by connecting to external database Database on which spreadsheet is created : pg **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create new table 2. Go to Metadata 3. See that metadata associated with system fields is already out of sync: "Column type changed(id), Column type changed(created_at), Column type changed(updated_at)" 4. Create new column 5. See that metadata associated with new column is out of sync, "Column type changed(newcolumn)" **Expected behavior** Column type should already be synced on creating a table and a column **Screenshots** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2394967/163896074-470edda8-6b0f-4b27-ac99-2f2f7c27ce17.png)

title: Bug: Cursor movements blocked during view rename
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Steps to reproduce ? double click on view name to toggle into edit mode - [ ] move cursor - [ ] left arrow & right arrow should move one text to left or right - [ ] up arrow & down arrow should move to beginning and end of text - [ ] drag mouse to select text - [ ] double click to select text, use cmd+c to copy; paste contents - throws error  Cannot read properties of undefined (reading `uidt`)  - [ ] lengthy view name needs to be truncated in toolbar view ![Screenshot 2022-12-22 at 3 51 44 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86527202/209113205-14079370-ca6d-428a-97bd-eeffdcf4db28.png) - [ ] use of delete key in view name edit mode throws error; backspace works fine  Grid.vue:405 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'uidt') at clearCell (Grid.vue:405:3) at HTMLDocument.handleKeyDown (index.ts:217:9)   Desired Behavior expect keyboard operations to work as desired  Project Details Node: **v16.14.0** Arch: **arm64** Platform: **darwin** Docker: **false** RootDB: **sqlite3** PackageVersion: **0.100.2**  Attachements _No response_

title: Bug: failed to execute the auto-generated function after setting the column as PK
description: Goal: change default id column to uuid (auto-generated) **Steps To Reproduce** 1. create a table 2. create a column "uuid" with auto-generate function, e.g. ``md5(random()::text || clock_timestamp()::text)::uuid``. Make it as NN & PK 3. delete default existing "id" column 4. create a new record -> no auto generate value 5. It prompts something like column with PK cannot be empty (bc no value begin auto-generated) however, 1. create a table 2. create a column "uuid" with auto-generate function, e.g. ``md5(random()::text || clock_timestamp()::text)::uuid``. NOT make it as NN & PK 3. delete default existing "id" column 4. create a new record -> able to auto generate value **Expected behavior** The value can be auto-generated. Node: **v12.22.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.10.3**

title: Bug: The server closed the connection
description: Node: **v12.22.12** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **mysql2** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.91.10** NocoDB used as docker : true NocoDB version : 0.91.10 Database used in NC_DB URL : mysql Project was created by clicking : New Project by connecting to external database Database on which spreadsheet is created : mysql OS on which NocoDB is running : Centos 7.4 Node.js version if running as node : Database version : 5.7 **Steps To Reproduce** 1. remote connections accessing databasesuse docker run command docker run -d --name=nocodb --restart always -v nocodb:/usr/app/data \ -e NC_DB="mysql2://remote host:port?u=noco&p=password&d=noco_db" \ nocodb/nocodb:latest 2. visit localhost successfully 3. page not closedidle for about 2 hoursthen add table andimport csv error  GET /api/v1/db/meta/nocodb/info 400 104 - 8.242 ms R :: Error: select * from `nc_models_v2` where `project_id` = 'p_bb896rlmj2ron9' and `base_id` = 'ds_4yzk0quzj8cyp3' order by `order` asc - Can't add new command when connection is in closed state  **Expected Behavior** Problem solving after restart docker Database provided by DBA I don't know whether it is a database configuration problem or a code problem **Screenshots** ![add bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42569476/174305728-33fa1a0c-298c-4911-8745-072ef9b18af7.png) ![bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42569476/174305734-b0096e8c-8225-49f6-b537-59784c81b748.png) If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. Join our discord : https://discord.gg/5RgZmkW for realtime help.

title: [Vue3] Deferred / Miscellaneous issues
description:
## Record issues that have a dependency on future work (for example Spreadsheet) to resolve Grid / Spreadsheet - [x] `on update` triggers webhook for `Single line text` gets triggered for every character input. In v1, it was once after the complete text was updated. Left Navigation Bar - [x] API Docs (Pages not found - base url) Right Navigation Bar - [x] link webhook drawer (covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3051) - [x] Copy View Not implemented (covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3078) - [x] Clicking Form View should rerender the view. See v1. (covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3078) Settings Tool Bar - [x] More Action > Upload CSV (covering in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3051) - [ ] Show password icon shrinks when password length is big for a shared view ![Screenshot 2022-08-02 at 10 01 44 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86527202/182292345-7cd2c9d9-7237-4513-87de-06ed5b48791e.png) Others - [x] Airtable import: Log window doesn't scroll down automatically - [x] Rating Select: antdv doesn't support object as value. need a workaround for it. Covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3016 - [x] Checkbox Select: antdv doesn't support object as value. need a workaround for it. Covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3016 - [x] formatting broken. e.g. vue
Save
 - [x] refactor - remove icon import. Autoload introduced in [here](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3019). Will be covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3044 (partially done now?) - [x] refactor - ditch toast (@wingkwong) - [x] Missing isUIAllowed (Covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3087) - [x] Sync i18n files from v1 (do it in the last step) - [x] lint issues - [x] refactor - change `context` and `utils` imports to `#imports` (cell will be handled by @wingkwong) changes introduced in v1 - [x] [Excel Import](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/2851)
patched_file_types: other-file | other-file | source-file | other-file | other-file | source-file | other-file | other-file | source-file

[Vue3] Deferred / Miscellaneous issues ## Record issues that have a dependency on future work (for example Spreadsheet) to resolve Grid / Spreadsheet - [x] `on update` triggers webhook for `Single line text` gets triggered for every character input. In v1, it was once after the complete text was updated. Left Navigation Bar - [x] API Docs (Pages not found - base url) Right Navigation Bar - [x] link webhook drawer (covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3051) - [x] Copy View Not implemented (covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3078) - [x] Clicking Form View should rerender the view. See v1. (covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3078) Settings Tool Bar - [x] More Action > Upload CSV (covering in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3051) - [ ] Show password icon shrinks when password length is big for a shared view ![Screenshot 2022-08-02 at 10 01 44 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86527202/182292345-7cd2c9d9-7237-4513-87de-06ed5b48791e.png) Others - [x] Airtable import: Log window doesn't scroll down automatically - [x] Rating Select: antdv doesn't support object as value. need a workaround for it. Covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3016 - [x] Checkbox Select: antdv doesn't support object as value. need a workaround for it. Covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3016 - [x] formatting broken. e.g. vue
Save
 - [x] refactor - remove icon import. Autoload introduced in [here](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3019). Will be covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3044 (partially done now?) - [x] refactor - ditch toast (@wingkwong) - [x] Missing isUIAllowed (Covered in https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/3087) - [x] Sync i18n files from v1 (do it in the last step) - [x] lint issues - [x] refactor - change `context` and `utils` imports to `#imports` (cell will be handled by @wingkwong) changes introduced in v1 - [x] [Excel Import](https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/2851) other-file other-file source-file other-file other-file source-file other-file other-file source-file

title: Confusing "Sign up" button loading state
description:
EDIT: See first comment below. Hi! While trying to explore nocodb I hit an issue on superuser sign up: as soon as I input a password, the Signup button freezes in an inactive loading state. This happens in Firefox an Chromium. I run nocodb with the following command: `podman run -d --name nocodb -p 8080:8080 --net=host nocodb/nocodb` (I need `--net=host` to access a database running on the host, in fact `-p` is redundant in this case.) In the logs I can see a suspicious 404: `POST /api/v1/auth/refresh-token 404 165 - 1.007 ms`. ![Screenshot 2021-06-07 at 09-58-56 Sign Up Noco](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/479389/120974051-5ae6a500-c778-11eb-8ea4-6770c9e8ec0f.png)

title: Bug: Currency fields with value 0 displayed as empty cells (Regression of #5607)
description: Please confirm that the bug report does not already exist - [x] I confirm there is no existing issue for this bug.  Steps to reproduce 1. Create a table with a field of type 'Currency'. 2. Insert a record with the currency value set to 0. 3. Observe that the cell appears empty. Most likely related to https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/issues/5607  Desired Behavior The cell should display '$0.00'.  Project Details NocoDB used as docker: true NocoDB version: 0.262.5 Database used in NC_DB URL: pg OS on which NocoDB is running: Ubuntu Database version: 16.6  Attachments ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dab93857-d2e9-4f5f-a59f-c6e1cb0eb091)

Most likely related to https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/issues/5607  Desired Behavior The cell should display '$0.00'.  Project Details NocoDB used as docker: true NocoDB version: 0.262.5 Database used in NC_DB URL: pg OS on which NocoDB is running: Ubuntu Database version: 16.6  Attachments ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/dab93857-d2e9-4f5f-a59f-c6e1cb0eb091) source-file

title: [Bug] Formula LOG on MSSQL
description: LOG formula works as documented for SQLITE, MySQL, PostgreSQL. Fails for MSSQL SQLITE documentation- In the two-argument version of log(B,X), the first argument is the base and the second argument is the operand. This is the same as in PostgreSQL and MySQL, but is reversed from SQL Server which uses the second argument as the base and the first argument as the operand. **Expected behavior** NocoDB documentation indicates LOG function to be log(B,X). MSSQL, its reversed.
text_for_topic_modeling: [Bug] Formula LOG on MSSQL LOG formula works as documented for SQLITE, MySQL, PostgreSQL. Fails for MSSQL SQLITE documentation- In the two-argument version of log(B,X), the first argument is the base and the second argument is the operand. This is the same as in PostgreSQL and MySQL, but is reversed from SQL Server which uses the second argument as the base and the first argument as the operand. **Expected behavior** NocoDB documentation indicates LOG function to be log(B,X). MSSQL, its reversed. documentation-file documentation-file source-file

title: Bug: Import not working
description: **Steps To Reproduce** Case 1: 1. create a project (sqlite) 2. create some tables 3. export to zip 4. import it back to the same project. it shows "some internal error occurred".  Request URL: <REDACTED>/dashboard/?q=sqlOp_xcMetaTablesImportZipToLocalFsAndDb&project_id=test_AcEi Request Method: POST Status Code: 400 Bad Request  Response  {"msg":"Project with id 'project_1_Qd9-' already exist"}  Case 2: 1. create a project (sqlite) 2. create some tables 3. export to zip 4. Delete the project 5. import zip in My Projects. it shows "some internal error occurred".  Request URL: <REDACTED</dashboard/?q=sqlOp_xcMetaTablesImportZipToLocalFsAndDb Request Method: POST Status Code: 403 Forbidden  Response:  {"msg":"Not allowed"}  **Expected behavior** Case 1: If it is not allowed to import to the same project. It may show some useful message instead of "some internal error occurred". **Further discussion:** if it is not allowed to import to the existing project. Then there is no point to include this import function in Project Metadata page. If the project does not exist, basically it will create a new one so it is weird to create a new project inside another project. Case 2: metadata is expected to be loaded. Node: **v12.22.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **sqlite3** PackageVersion: **0.11.6**

title: Bug: Groupby doesn't work on formula fields with numbers
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [X] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Steps to reproduce ? 1. Create two fields with type number, a and b and populate with values 2. Create a third field with type formula, c, (formula is {b}-{a}) 3. Select group by field c. 4. It shows the correct number of fields within count when collapsed, but on expanding it is a blank state and the count reduces to zero.  Desired Behavior The goupby feature should work as it does with other fields. title: Issues when handling spaces
description: Hey! Not sure if these issues are sqlite-specific or apply to all databases. **Description** Creating a database with spaces within its name, or creating a column with spaces within its name, cause issues. When creating a database containing space, while the table is properly created, it can't be accessed and modified by nocodb anymore, details in the next section. When creating a column name with a space, the column value is injected within the query itself unescaped, which will fail and is a SQL injection. This is an issue for "normal" columns as only the first segment will be the resulting column name: `test col` will have an actual name of of `test`, while nocobd still tries to insert into `test col`. **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create a new table `test table` 1.1. The resulting table within the database is `xa1_test table`, should likely be normalized to `test_table` 2. Attempting to save a value has an error: Attempting to access a non-existing route (404) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9059487/122080600-62d3c400-cdcc-11eb-99dd-dfbc3ec4fcd5.png) **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create a new column `col with space` 1.1. The resulting table within the db is `xa1_col`, due to a lack of sanitization when inserting the value. 2. Attempt inserting a row 3. The insertion will fail with the message _The table X does not have a column named `col with space`_ **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create a new column `col with space 2` 2. The insertion fails due to an invalid sql query. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9059487/122081071-c827b500-cdcc-11eb-8735-ea90690d2220.png) **Expected behavior** All of the above working. For values with spaces, I would expect an internal normalized name to be generated, with an external nice value to be mapped and used within the app. I believe this is already partially done for the view, as the tables are all underscores, but it does not work with the spaces within the column and table names.  NocoDB used as docker : false NocoDB version : `0.9.31` (latest npm release) Database used in NC_DB URL : sqlite3 Database on which spreadsheet is created : sqlite3 OS on which NocoDB is running : Windows Node.js version if running as node : 14.16.0

title: Bug: Renaming of Belongs To column
description: Please confirm if bug report does NOT exists already ? - [x] I confirm there is no existing issue for this  Steps to reproduce ? I use "Has Many" column to link the same table. As a result, I get 2 columns for that, but the second one "Belongs To" marked as system and when I try to rename it, the error `Editing system key not supported` happens. If "Belongs To" column in other table, it is possible to rename it.  Desired Behavior A possibility to change the name of "Belongs To" column as other ones.  Project Details Node: **v18.18.2** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** RootDB: **sqlite3** PackageVersion: **0.204.0**  Attachments _No response_

title: npm test is throwing error Cache init failed during database reading
description: Please provide dev environment versions of your system node -v **8.4.0** ( xmysql requires node >= 7.6.0 ) npm -v **5.3.0** mysql --version **2.15.0** xmysql --version - - - Provide steps to reproduce this issue Cloned the project sh cd xmysql npm install npm test  sh mocha tests/*.js --exit xmysql : tests Cache init failed during database reading { Error: connect ECONNREFUSED 127.0.0.1:3306 at Object._errnoException (util.js:1041:11) at _exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:1064:20) at TCPConnectWrap.afterConnect [as oncomplete] (net.js:1153:14)  at Protocol._enqueue (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/node_modules/mysql/lib/protocol/Protocol.js:145:48) at Protocol.handshake (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/node_modules/mysql/lib/protocol/Protocol.js:52:23) at PoolConnection.connect (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/node_modules/mysql/lib/Connection.js:130:18) at Pool.getConnection (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/node_modules/mysql/lib/Pool.js:48:16) at Pool.query (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/node_modules/mysql/lib/Pool.js:202:8) at Xsql.dbCacheInitAsync (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/lib/xsql.js:36:15) at Xsql.init (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/lib/xsql.js:26:10) at Xapi.init (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/lib/xapi.js:37:16) at Context.<anonymous> (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/tests/tests.js:42:9) at callFnAsync (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/node_modules/mocha/lib/runnable.js:377:21) at Hook.Runnable.run (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/node_modules/mocha/lib/runnable.js:324:7) at next (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/node_modules/mocha/lib/runner.js:304:10) at Immediate._onImmediate (/Users/shashi/openSource/xmysql/node_modules/mocha/lib/runner.js:334:5) at runCallback (timers.js:781:20) at tryOnImmediate (timers.js:743:5) at processImmediate [as _immediateCallback] (timers.js:714:5) code: 'ECONNREFUSED', errno: 'ECONNREFUSED', syscall: 'connect', address: '127.0.0.1', port: 3306, fatal: true } undefined - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - Database : classicmodels Number of resources : 0 REST APIs Generated : 0

title: Nested fields query param does not respect '*' to include all fields
description: I want to get all nested fields for the nested column table Since 0.90.10 it started to only return primary key and value for nested colums, f.e. `/api/v1/db/data/noco/AppName/SomeTable/8` returns  { <other data>, SomeNestedColumn: { id: 1, Name: 'name string', } }  Specifying fields directly does work, but is not practical for my use case, since we have a lot of columns and need all of them: `/api/v1/db/data/noco/AppName/SomeTable/8?nested[SomeNestedColumn][fields]=somefield,anotherfield`  { <other data>, SomeNestedColumn: { somefield: 'foo', anotherfield: 'bar', } }  I tried using '*' for it to return all fields but it returns the same as not specifying the fields param (only primary key and value): `/api/v1/db/data/noco/AppName/SomeTable/8?nested[SomeNestedColumn][fields]=*`  { <other data>, SomeNestedColumn: { id: 1, Name: 'name string', } }  I suspect this does code in #1856 does not handle the '*' case correctly: https://github.com/nocodb/nocodb/pull/1856/files#diff-7768878066d19300f9872bc703464d8c2b7f2c79b747d9ee1fd9660805d97e17R48-R74  Node: **v12.22.12** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **false** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.90.10**

title: Unable to update/delete/select records for composite primary keys from swagger
description: In swagger the primary key field is set to integer by default because it considers the default primary key to be 'id'. But if we add a new primary key [composite along with default 'id' key], then while updating/deleting/selecting we need to provide value for primary-key in the format <id-field-value>___<secondary-primary-key-value>. So this primary key is a string. Can this primary-key type be changed to string instead? Also if there is a way to remove dependency from default 'id' field, it would be great help?
text_for_topic_modeling: Unable to update/delete/select records for composite primary keys from swagger In swagger the primary key field is set to integer by default because it considers the default primary key to be 'id'. But if we add a new primary key [composite along with default 'id' key], then while updating/deleting/selecting we need to provide value for primary-key in the format <id-field-value>___<secondary-primary-key-value>. So this primary key is a string. Can this primary-key type be changed to string instead? Also if there is a way to remove dependency from default 'id' field, it would be great help? source-file source-file source-file source-file

title: dynamic is not working
description: Hi team, first of all star to your efforts <3 I am sending an post request to dynamic api, but system is not response as required as it through 404 error, ajax code: `$(document).ready(function(){ $.ajax({ url: 'http://127.0.0.1:3000/dynamic', method: 'POST', data:{ "query": "select * from ?? limit 20", "params": ["issuedetailsv3"] }, success: function (data){ console.log(data); }, error : function (){ console.log('this is an error'); } }) });` following errors, > POST http://127.0.0.1:3000/dynamic 404 (Not Found) > POST /dynamic 404 147 - 3.395 ms Please provide dev environment versions of your system node -v v9.0.0 ( xmysql requires node >= 7.6.0 ) npm -v 5.5.1 mysql --version 5.7.20 xmysql --version 0.2.0 - - - Provide steps to reproduce this issue or Provide minimum code to reproduce this issue or HTTP request,response,error snapshot of this issue - - - Mark issue with suitable label if it is clear what this issue is.

title: Migration from 0.84.16 to 0.90.3 failed (mssql, docker)
description: MSSQL only supports one ALTER COLUMN per ALTER TABLE (see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/statements/alter-table-transact-sql?redirectedfrom=MSDN&view=sql-server-ver15) **Please enter the following details** please provide the following details : NocoDB used as docker : true NocoDB version : 0.90.3 Database used in NC_DB URL : mssql Project was created by clicking : New Project by connecting to external database Database on which spreadsheet is created : mssql OS on which NocoDB is running : Linux Node.js version if running as node : Database version : 15.0.4198.2 **Steps To Reproduce** 1. docker stop; docker rm 2. Update docker image to latest (dc4717b4f34a) 3. docker run 4. Dashboard isn't shown in frontend ("Cannot GET /") 5. See error **Expected behavior** Frontend starting; Dashboard shown; Migration done; No error in log **Error** App started successfully. Visit ->  Tue, 19 Apr 2022 12:11:39 GMT tedious deprecated The default value for `config.options.enableArithAbort` will change from `false` to `true` in the next major version of `tedious`. title: Blank page after filtering; need to click page in pagination to see results
description: Node: **v12.22.6** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **false** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.81.1** **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Create table with more than 25 records. For example, 30. Therefore, pagination shows with page 1 and 2. 2. Go to the last (second) page 3. Create new filter, that must show less records, for example 20. So pagination show only 1 page 4. We see blank page. To see the filtered records, we need manually click the page 1 in the pagination. **Expected behavior** If filtering changing the number of pages, then we should be automatically directed to the page with records

description: Testing against a pinned and odd NodeJS release makes not much sense. NodeJS reached its EOL some time ago. Only even release branches are longkiving and become LTS branches. https://github.com/o1lab/xmysql/blob/master/.travis.yml
