title: Unable to use handlebar syntax in mobile number field of Twilio plugin?
description: NocoDB used as docker : true NocoDB version : **0.82.0** Database used in NC_DB URL : pg Project was created by clicking : New Project Database on which spreadsheet is created : pg OS on which NocoDB is running : linux Node.js version if running as node : **v12.22.6** Database version : unknown **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Go to Automations 2. Add a twilio webhook 3. use a number field from the row data as the mobile number: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/591242/142658422-33e429b5-ec07-4434-894f-1c9b76376bbd.png) 4. In heroku error log: 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863087+00:00 app[web.1]: RestException [Error]: The 'To' number is not a valid phone number. 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863091+00:00 app[web.1]: at success (/usr/src/app/node_modules/twilio/lib/base/Version.js:135:15) 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863091+00:00 app[web.1]: at Promise_then_fulfilled (/usr/src/app/node_modules/q/q.js:766:44) 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863092+00:00 app[web.1]: at Promise_done_fulfilled (/usr/src/app/node_modules/q/q.js:835:31) 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863093+00:00 app[web.1]: at Fulfilled_dispatch [as dispatch] (/usr/src/app/node_modules/q/q.js:1229:9) 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863093+00:00 app[web.1]: at Pending_become_eachMessage_task (/usr/src/app/node_modules/q/q.js:1369:30) 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863094+00:00 app[web.1]: at RawTask.call (/usr/src/app/node_modules/asap/asap.js:40:19) 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863094+00:00 app[web.1]: at flush (/usr/src/app/node_modules/asap/raw.js:50:29) 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863095+00:00 app[web.1]: at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:79:11) { 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863096+00:00 app[web.1]: status: 400, 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863096+00:00 app[web.1]: code: 21211, 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863096+00:00 app[web.1]: moreInfo: 'https://www.twilio.com/docs/errors/21211', 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863097+00:00 app[web.1]: details: undefined 2021-11-19T16:23:32.863097+00:00 app[web.1]: } **it works fine if I type the exact same number manually into the form.** Therefore I suspect that handlebar is not supported in that input box? **Expected behavior** I expect to be able to use handlebar syntax in the "Comma separated mobile #" field for the Twilio plugin.

title: Handle additional params in database connection
description: This is related to the issue we discussed it yesterday. - When `options=project=project.name` & `ssl=true` is present we need to handle it in - [x] NC_DB : turning these additional params as part of database config - [x] DATABASE_URL : turning these additional params into NC_DB params - [x] Project create (GUI) We should also try to make this as a generic solution for other params

title: "Email must be valid" error for valid email with a four-character top-level domain
description: Version: Latest Docker When attempting to create a new user that has a four-character top-level domain in the email address, an "E-mail must be valid" error is returned. For example, the email test@test.live is said to be invalid. However, I was able to sign up with that email, without seeing any errors. Steps to Replicate Create a new user with a four-character TLD in the email such as "test@test.live" Sign out Try to sign back in Observe the "E-mail must be valid" message What is Expected? The Email is valid per RFC spec and should be allowed.

title: Bug: ' not escaped in MultiSelect option
description: Node: **v12.22.6** Arch: **arm** Docker: **true** Database: **mysql2** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.83.8** Project was created by clicking : **New Project** OS on which NocoDB is running : **aarch64 GNU/Linux** **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Add a new table name `test` 2. Add a new column 3. Column type: MultiSelect 4. Create an option containing the character `'`, for example `a'a` 5. save the new column 6. See error `You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MariaDB server version for the right syntax to use ` on docker logs, and `update table.test failed` on front-end **Expected behavior** Use of `'` should be possible in a MultiSelect option. **Cause** `'` is not escaped. I can escape it during the MultiSelect creation with `\`, but then it is displayed as `a\'a` in the front-end.

title: Cannot read property 'isView' of undefined
description:
Hi All, Here are my dev environment details. - node: v10.2.1 - npm: 5.6.0 - mysql: 8.0 - xmysql: 0.4.5 - - - Tried to generate the API for the a basic database with a single table with two columns. I got the following error: Call Stack (node:3444) [DEP0095] DeprecationWarning: timers.enroll() is deprecated. Please use setTimeout instead. (node:3444) [DEP0096] DeprecationWarning: timers.unenroll() is deprecated. Please use clearTimeout instead. C:\Users\ashan\AppData\Roaming

title: Problem with API for Relation Rows
description: Project Info  Node: **v12.22.12** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **true** RootDB: **pg** PackageVersion: **0.91.1**  Hallo! I'm testing API for Relation Rows But, when I try to send a test request, I get an error Parameter columnName turns red (see screenshot) I have two tables: "Sheet1" and "Cars" (see screenshots) Table "Sheet1" has Link To Another Record - it is column "Car". The screenshot 3 shows an example of an attempt to send the Relation Row List method. I click the Execute button and the columnName parameter turns red. Request not sent A similar situation with the Relation Row Add and Relation Row Remove methods.  I don't know if this is a bug or I'm doing something wrong.  ![screenshot-noco bittapp ru-2022 05 31-12_42_23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/106589126/171162126-1a6c9d8c-0069-4350-84d4-d8b7477aaebe.png) ![screenshot-noco bittapp ru-2022 05 31-12_43_02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/106589126/171162213-e10831df-ce13-43a6-b604-db005ea04f58.png) ![screenshot-noco bittapp ru-2022 05 31-13_22_46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/106589126/171162483-70033e82-92c6-46fd-be8a-a246c0f4c959.png)

title: Swagger UI doesn't use NC_PUBLIC_URL
description: **Please enter the following details** Node: **v12.22.1** Arch: **x64** Platform: **linux** Docker: **true** Database: **pg** ProjectOnRootDB: **false** RootDB: **mysql2** PackageVersion: **0.9.33** **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Run NocoDB using Docker, and set the NC_PUBLIC_URL environment variable (e.g. `NC_PUBIC_URL=https://nocodb.example.com`). Serve the site at that URL using a reverse proxy. 2. From NocoDB (at the public URL), click avatar > Swagger APIs Doc to open the Swagger UI 3. Despite being served from the public URL, Swagger shows the base URL as localhost:8080, which causes the endpoints to fail when tested. **Expected behavior** I would expect Swagger to use the public URL to generate the REST endpoints. **Screenshots** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2007008/122275796-1a8ed180-ceb2-11eb-9146-0ccbd5886d94.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2007008/122275858-2d090b00-ceb2-11eb-838d-e7f85ab628b2.png)

Despite being served from the public URL, Swagger shows the base URL as localhost:8080, which causes the endpoints to fail when tested. **Expected behavior** I would expect Swagger to use the public URL to generate the REST endpoints. **Screenshots** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2007008/122275796-1a8ed180-ceb2-11eb-9146-0ccbd5886d94.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2007008/122275858-2d090b00-ceb2-11eb-838d-e7f85ab628b2.png) source-file other-file other-file other-file other-file other-file other-file other-file other-file other-file source-file source-file source-file documentation-file documentation-file documentation-file other-file other-file documentation-file documentation-file documentation-file documentation-file documentation-file documentation-file documentation-file documentation-file documentation-file source-file config-file documentation-file documentation-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file test-file source-file documentation-file test-file test-file test-file test-file

title: Consider dropping the requirement for specific characters in passwords
description: The current sign up form requires "Atleast (sic) 8 letters with one Uppercase, one number and one special letter". [Per NIST](https://pages.nist.gov/800-63-3/sp800-63b.html), requiring specific character types in a password is not recommended (emphasis mine): > __Verifiers SHOULD NOT impose other composition rules (e.g., requiring mixtures of different character types or prohibiting consecutively repeated characters) for memorized secrets.__ Verifiers SHOULD NOT require memorized secrets to be changed arbitrarily (e.g., periodically). However, verifiers SHALL force a change if there is evidence of compromise of the authenticator. I think the present requirement actually lowers the entropy of resulting passwords by effectively making them shorter (it's harder to remember a short `p@ssw0rd`-style password than a longer `passphrases are better`-style one). ![Screenshot 2021-06-07 at 09-58-56 Sign Up Noco](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/479389/120975976-8cf90680-c77a-11eb-9afc-e9a492a6e8ae.png)

title: Feature request : Import / Export file formats (CSV, JSON)
description: Hello ! My data is in a huge csv file (2M lines). I would like to import it into a table. Ideally it would auto-create a table, taking the column names from the first line of CSV. I would like to upload the file from my local disk, from my web browser. As a bonus, it would be nice to have flexibility on the CSV format : my file is using "|" as a separator rather than "," (but I could transform my data before uploading it, so it's not a hard requirement. But it's preferable because I would like minimize the steps that I have to do in my workflow.) Thanks for this cool product !

title: Bug: ID column is unknown
description: In most of my tables the PK columns aren't visible and therefore I can't execute queries like *SELECT * FROM SomeTable Where SomeEntry_ID* Interestingly, the ID columns seem to be unknown. This is the error message I get via Swagger: `Undefined binding(s) detected when compiling FIRST. Undefined column(s): [SomeEntry_ID] query: select top(?)`
